Botrini's Restaurant - Reinvent Greek culinary traditions, showcasing the soul of the country's rich heritage in a captivating blend of Greek and Mediterranean flavors

A contemporary interpretation of Greek culinary tradition through an anthology of delectable creations. Explore our gastronomic wonderland , a celebration of food as culture , memory & sensory pleasure.

Design: G Design Studio | Code: Lab21 | Copywriting: Vassilis Economidis

B o o k a T a b l e

B o o k A T a b l e

Book your table online

Make a Reservation

Want someone special to experience the Botrini’s Restaurant?

Gift Card

Opening Hours

Tuesday – Saturday
19:00 – 24:00

Chef’s Table

Our Chef’s Table offers a truly immersive journey. Dine in the heart of our kitchen right in front of our pass and enjoy the thrilling action of our kitchen brigade as dishes are created right before your eyes. Here, we serve a menu designed by our Chef in order for our Chef’s table guests to try the best of our cuisine.

Book Chef’s Table

Events

At Botrini’s we offer world-class group-dining experiences in one of the most historic Michelin star awarded restaurants of Greece. We enjoy bringing people together and immersing them in Ettore Botrini’s unique approach to Greek cuisine. Contact us directly at +30 210 68 57 323-4 or info@botrinis.com .

Special Menus

If you desire a special menu (Vegetarian, Gluten Free, etc.), please notify us 24 hours in advance.

Dress Code

Smart – elegant.
No shorts or sandals for men.

Gift Cards

Offer a unique gift to your loved ones. Invite them for a dinner at Botrini’s!
You can select from a variety of options and the gift card will be sent to your email. Please feel free to contact us for more information.

Children

We love children, but we also love a quiet dining room, therefore we do not accept children under 12 in our main dining room. Younger children are invited to dine in our private dining room, when available. Also, please note that we do not have high chairs or booster seats.

Pets

Generally, pets are not allowed in the restaurant. If you have a special request, please contact us ahead of time.

Reservation/Cancellation Policy

For reservations, a credit card is mandatory to secure the table. Please note that there is no charge to your card. You can cancel your reservation without any penalty up to 24 hours before your arrival. A fee of €40 per person may be charged on the event of a late cancellation (less than 24 hours from the time of the reservation) or failing to appear at the restaurant without prior notice.

Delay Policy

In case of significant delay without prior notification, your table might be released and our cancellation policy applied.

T h e M e n u s

T h e M e n u s

Varkada

/va·rká·da/

a tranquil trip in a small boat, often shared among friends or family

/pe’ri.pa.tos/

a leisurely walk taken for pleasure
View menu

Peripatos

by Ettore Botrini

Our Stories

Behind each dish of the tasting menus lies a story that Ettore Botrini shares with our guests. Each of these stories, written on the cards that we present to you at the table, before each course, composes the unique diary of the tasteful memories from our chef’s childhood, elements of our philosophy and the history of the Botrini family or narrates tales from the daily life of people, such as the habit of Tuscan fishermen to marinate in seawater. We invite you to discover them.

The Cellar

At Botrini’s we love wine. It is part of our gastronomic proposal, as it compliments and interacts with our food. Explore our cellar and our expertly developed wine program.

Our Cellar

The Chef’s Table

Our Chef’s Table offers a truly immersive journey. Dine in the heart of our kitchen right in front of our pass and enjoy the thrilling action of our kitchen brigade as dishes are created right before your eyes. Here, we serve a menu designed by our Chef in order for our Chef’s table guests to try the best of our cuisine.

Βοοk The Chef’s Table

O u r C e l l a r

O u r C e l l a r

At Botrini’s we love wine. It is part of our gastronomic proposal, as it compliments and interacts with our food. In our two cellars we offer access to more than 900 different wine labels from the Greek and international vineyard!

Through these wines, we are given the opportunity to travel with you to the places where they were produced in order to enjoy them with all our senses. To examine different terroirs, varieties, winemaking styles. To meet the different people who produce them and to tell their stories. To explore the fascinating world of wine. From the Cyclades and the most interesting wine regions of Greece, Italy and Portugal to the northern vineyards of Europe, the Moselle Valley, Alsace and Champagne all the way to the New World, Chile and Australia.

Botrinis-Winepairings-Peripatos-Sep24-EN.pdf
Botrinis-Winepairings-Taxidi-Sep24-EN.pdf
Our Wine List

In curating our list and our wine pairings, we have focused on highlighting the Greek vineyard, as well as styles of wines that ideally accompany our gastronomy such as Champagne and old vintages of Santorini Assyrtiko and German Riesling.

Visit us and discover one of the most expertly developed wine programs in the country!

O u r P h i l o s o p h y

O u r P h i l o s o p h y

Our philosophy focuses on the harmonious coupling of the contradictory elements that float in our gastronomic universe: rural and “scholarly” cuisine, nostalgia and innovation, sea and earth, Apollonian and Dionysian. Our chef, transforming his memories into flavors, textures and aromas. He creates sensory landscapes.

His menus draw inspiration from his family tradition, from the history of the places where he grew up, lived or traveled and he tells the stories of these places, and from the world of visual arts and literature. His goal is for you to experience the meal at Botrini’s as a gastronomic experience, like a journey into a world of aromas and flavors.

Our Emblem

Our emblem is Pegasus, a pure white, winged horse, a unique mythical being, starring in one of the longest-standing myths of Western civilization. In Tuscany, which, along with Corfu, is one of the two homelands of Ettore Botrini, Pegasus symbolized the passage from darkness and chaos to the freedom of spirit. Under this emblem’s aegis are nestled three archetypal symbols, that represent Mother Nature’s abundance, and the Mediterranean diet: Wheat, olive oil, wine.

Herring, A Journey
Through Time

According to “Deipnosophistis”, an important figure of Greek gastronomic literature, every cuisine has two sources: a rural and a “scholarly”.

Rural, folk cuisine is domestic, agricultural, and inextricably linked to its land. It is defined by austerity of expressive means and is passed on from generation to generation through the unconscious channels of imitation and habit.

“Scholarly”, cosmopolitan cuisine evolves in societies of great economic prosperity. It is characterized by creativity and originality resulting from the ceaseless exploration of gastronomic pleasures. It progresses through the work of professional chefs. It constantly explores new ingredients, and it borrows or invents techniques.

During Ettore Botrini’s childhood, the workers of Corfu smoked herring, a ‘fish of the mountain’, in newspapers in order to preserve it for a long time. They enjoyed it with other humble ingredients such as cornbread and wild greens they found in the countryside. This dish is an embodiment of the above-mentioned theory: an application of the coupling of rural and “scholarly” cuisine.

Deipnosophistis, Deipnosophistis, 1991

Ethos

We are committed to sustainable practices. We honor the Greek terroir. We invariably source our seasonal, high-quality ingredients from small local producers, whose devotion inspire our gastronomy. We employ techniques that allow us to use every peel or bread crumb. We create pickles, garum and stocks out of matter often considered waste. We refrain from using plastic and we recycle. We inform our guests about the importance of those causes through our stories.

Our Peaches from Last Summer

The act of eating is our deepest connection with nature, with the non-human world. During this critical period, the public debate on culinary sustainability has escalated encouragingly. More than ever, we seek seasonality and locality. We talk about sustainable development, our footprint, and culinary ethics.

For us, the basic principle is simple: We ought to cultivate, cook, eat, and function in a way that is in harmony with the earth. One of the applications of this doctrine is “zero waste”: the full utilization of ingredients.

For our pre-dessert, we have chosen the renowned peaches of the plains of Imathia, in Northern Greece. They are harvested at their peak of maturity by dedicated growers, from whom we directly source them. We process them according to the tradition of the region to make a compote with elderflower syrup. We take them out of our jars, several months later, to offer them to you. With their seeds and skins, we make our own peach vinegar.

O u r R e s t a u r a n t

O u r R e s t a u r a n t

Botrini’s is based in a two-story house -a former elementary school-, with a red tile roof surrounded by a beautiful green garden where we accommodate our guests during the long Greek summers.

The restaurant is the realization of one of Ettore Botrini’s oldest dreams, who had envisioned an establishment that would provide hope to people who have lost it, while offering guests, what he considers to be, one of life’s greatest pleasures: the sharing of food with loved ones.

It came into existence in 2011 through Botrini’s Project, a successful TV program based around the idea of providing young people, who has found themselves alienated, with a vision through gastronomy. Chef Botrini recruited 12 individuals in need for a career opportunity, with no prior restaurant experience, to form the brigade of the fine dining restaurant. The operational structure did not comply to traditional kitchen hierarchies and all team members worked as equals under the guidance of the Chef. The restaurant was awarded with its first Michelin Star in 2014, only two and a half years after its opening. In the years that followed, the restaurant was established as one of the most important restaurants of the country.

Our neighbourhood

Our neighborhood has a distinct identity. While Chalandri is filled with parks, red-tile houses, cycle paths and green spots like the Rematia Suburban Woodland, it is also known for its buzzing center -just a short walk from Botrini’s- a constellation of pedestrian streets with a lively bar scene and beautiful little cafes and shops.

O u r T e a m

O u r t e a m

Ettore Botrini

Chef Patron

“The most important & influential Chef in Greece of the Decade 2011-2020”

The FNL Guide, 2021

“The most influential Chef in Greece as voted by Greek Chefs”

Athinorama, 2023

Ettore Botrini is a Greek-Italian Chef born and raised in Corfu. He was inspired to become a Chef by his father’s love for cooking. He studied Tourism Management at the Ecole Hôtelière de Lausanne. He had the chance to gain culinary experience in 3 Michelin star-rated restaurants in France and Spain and work side by side with some world-class Chefs including his current friend, Martin Berasategui.

He is involved in a series of renowned gastronomic projects, and he is the Chef-Patron of two restaurants: Botrini’s, and Etrusco restaurant in Corfu, named after his father, one of the most historic restaurants in Greece.

According to Fnl Guide 2020, Ettore Botrini’s main contribution to Greek gastronomy is that he has been charged -by the most important culinary critics and institutions- with paving the way for the evolution of Greek cuisine as “in addition to being the best chef in the country… he is the man who ‘taught’ modern techniques to Greek customers and chefs.”

He is one of the most recognizable personalities of the Greek culinary scene as he has starred in a series of TV shows including the Greek version of “Kitchen Nightmare”. He speaks five languages fluently (Greek, Italian, Spanish, French & English).

Ilias Ntoukas

Executive R&D Chef

Ilias Doukas entered a kitchen by chance at the age of 21 and immediately decided to abandon his studies in a different field to devote himself to cooking. He left Athens, where he grew up, at the age of 26 to take on roles at some of the most important restaurants in the world. He worked in the kitchens of Fat Duck (3 Michelin stars, 1 time World’s Best Restaurant – 50 Best, England), Quintonil (2 Michelin stars, Mexico), Noma (3 Michelin stars, 4 times World’s Best Restaurant – 50 Best, Denmark), Alchemist (2 Michelin stars) and found his home for 5 years at Hiša Franko, which he assisted as a sous chef, be awarded first with 2 and then with 3 Michelin stars (2023) and with the Michelin green star.

At Hiša Franko he learned to cook with ingredients that each place offers (in this case the mountains of northwestern Slovenia) and made locality and sustainability the main principles of his culinary approach. His aesthetic in cooking is minimalist and is inspired by the creativity of Ferran Adrià and the love of exploration of René Redzepi. He loves seafood, tomatoes and wild herbs that he collects himself with his teams. Since 2025 he has been working as Executive Research & Development Chef at Botrini’s.

Thanos Nasiakos

Restaurant Manager

Τhanos, our restaurant manager, has over 10 years of experience in the hospitality and restaurant industry, having worked in various Michelin star restaurants both in Greece and abroad. With a degree in Tourism Management, he has successfully combined his knowledge with his passion for quality and excellent service.His passion for hospitality and attention to detail are the keys to our success, ensuring that every guest enjoys a unique and unforgettable experience. He always strives for harmony between gastronomy and hospitality. With dedication and respect for our guests, our manager is always committed to ensuring the best possible experience for everyone who walks through our doors.

Alexandros Gkaraflis

Head Sommelier

Alexandros, as the head sommelier of our restaurant, decided to get involved with wine at the end of 2021. A trip with his girlfriend to the Douro Valley in Portugal was the spark for his wine journey. In less than a year, he managed to obtain Level 3 certification in wines from the global WSET organization, as well as the Greek Hestia certification, which specializes in the Greek vineyard. He holds Level 2 in spirits, and in April 2025 he will begin the challenging journey to obtain Level 4 in wines. He has had the privilege of serving as Head Sommelier at a distinguished five-star hotel, as well as Sommelier at a Michelin-starred establishment. He believes that the most successful wine and food pairing is simply good company!

T h e A w a r d s

Design: G Design Studio | Code: Lab21 | Copywriting: Vassilis Economidis

C o n s u l t i n g S e r v i c e s

C o n s u l t i n g S e r v i c e s

Ettore Botrini & his team undertake or strategically assist in the creation and execution of gastronomic projects.

Our team of experts in the Food & Beverage industry can contribute to all the stages of the development of successful restaurants and F&B outlets.

From the creation of the concept, the business plan, and the menu to the recruitment & training of the kitchen and Front of House staff, the development of the guest journey, operational manuals and SOPs, food & labor cost analysis, equipment & art de la table, to creating a plan to increase sales, we analyze the needs of your business and offer customized solutions.

Most importantly, we design unique gastronomic proposals with the distinct signature of Ettore Botrini, the most influential Chef in Greece.

Partnerships

Additionally, to Botrini’s and Etrusco, two of the most historic restaurants in Greece owned by Ettore Botrini, our team operate some of the most successful restaurants of the country. Selene, one of the most significant restaurants in Greece, in 2022, just one year after being operated by our team as Selene by Ettore Botrini, won the Restaurant of the Year award by FNL, a prestigious culinary guide. We currently hold successful partnerships with world-class hotels and resorts such as One&Only Aesthesis, Katikies, Four Seasons Cyprus, and Ikos orchestrating a wide range of Food & Beverage operations from fine dining to casual establishments. Our notable cooperation with La Pasteria upgraded the restaurant chain’s gastronomic offering while establishing it as one of the most recognizable restaurant brands in Greece.

O u r M a n a g e m e n t T e a m

Antonis Floros

Managing Director

Antonis Floros has an extensive range of expertise in the food industry. As a front- line executive for the Vivartia Group of Companies for 20 years, he has acquired a wide range of skills in evaluating, controlling, and restructuring restaurants, effectively managing staff, and ensuring operational success.

Some of his main accomplishments include the successful designing and launching of 15 new La Pasteria restaurants (2003 – 2013) and his successful tenure as a Maritime Activities Manager of Vivartia in charge of monitoring the operations of all onboard Food & Beverage Outlets (2015 – 2019).

He has been Ettore Botrini’s trusted associate for decades and the General Manager of Ettore Botrini Restaurants and Consulting Services since 2020.

Vassilis Economidis

Director of Operations

Vassilis Economidis specializes in Food & Beverage Management which he has practiced in prominent Michelin star-rated restaurants, iconic 5-star hotels and in cities such as London, Athens, and Copenhagen.

He has also worked as a college professor focusing on the fields of Tourism and Hospitality. Deeply passionate about gastronomy, he has been researching it from an academic perspective and traveling the globe in an endless exploration of its diverse gastronomic cultures.

He has a Master’s degree in Marketing Communications, and extensive studies on hospitality and wine (WSET level 3). He is currently the Director of Operations for the restaurants owned and operated by Ettore Botrini.

C o n t a c t

B o t r i n i ’ s R e s t a u r a n t

Vasileos Georgiou B’ 24B
Chalandri, Athens Greece

Tuesday – Saturday
19:00 – 24:00

Find us here: Google maps

+30 210 68 57 323
+30 210 68 57 324
info@botrinis.com

Instagram
Michelin Guide

“A modern, elegant restaurant occupying a former school in the up-and-coming Chalandri district and located slightly away from the city’s tourist hotspots.”

Michelin Guide

Nestled in the charming neighborhood of Chalandri, our restaurant offers quick access to unique places of interest such as the Golden Hall, the most popular shopping center of Athens, and the Olympic Museum. It’s, also, conveniently located just a small drive from the airport and the center of Athens.

DISTANCES:

  • Olympic Museum
    20 min walk
  • El. Venizelos Airport
    25 min drive
  • Golden Hall
    10 min walk
  • Acropolis Museum
    20 min drive
  • Rematia Suburban Woodland
    10 min walk

Events

At Botrini’s we design elegant events and offer world-class group-dining experiences in one of the most historic Michelin star-rated restaurants of Greece. We enjoy bringing people together and immersing them in Ettore Botrini’s unique approach to Greek cuisine.

Contact us directly at +30 210 68 57 323-4 or info@botrinis.com.

Careers

As we maintain an extensive network of partners throughout Greece and Cyprus, we are in constant search of talented professionals with a passion for gastronomy and hospitality to join our kitchens and Front of House teams.

Send your application at info@botrinis.com

discovered_links.clean_content:
We use cookies to enhance your browsing experience, serve personalized ads or content, and analyze our traffic. By clicking "Accept All", you consent to our use of cookies.

Customize Consent Preferences

We use cookies to help you navigate efficiently and perform certain functions. You will find detailed information about all cookies under each consent category below.

The cookies that are categorized as "Necessary" are stored on your browser as they are essential for enabling the basic functionalities of the site. ...

Always Active

Necessary cookies are required to enable the basic features of this site, such as providing secure log-in or adjusting your consent preferences. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable data.

  • Cookie
    cookieyes-consent
  • Duration
    1 year
  • Description
    CookieYes sets this cookie to remember users' consent preferences so that their preferences are respected on subsequent visits to this site. It does not collect or store any personal information about the site visitors.

Functional cookies help perform certain functionalities like sharing the content of the website on social media platforms, collecting feedback, and other third-party features.

No cookies to display.

Analytical cookies are used to understand how visitors interact with the website. These cookies help provide information on metrics such as the number of visitors, bounce rate, traffic source, etc.

  • Cookie
    _ga_*
  • Duration
    1 year 1 month 4 days
  • Description
    Google Analytics sets this cookie to store and count page views.
  • Cookie
    _ga
  • Duration
    1 year 1 month 4 days
  • Description
    Google Analytics sets this cookie to calculate visitor, session and campaign data and track site usage for the site's analytics report. The cookie stores information anonymously and assigns a randomly generated number to recognise unique visitors.

Performance cookies are used to understand and analyze the key performance indexes of the website which helps in delivering a better user experience for the visitors.

No cookies to display.

Advertisement cookies are used to provide visitors with customized advertisements based on the pages you visited previously and to analyze the effectiveness of the ad campaigns.

No cookies to display.

Other uncategorized cookies are those that are being analyzed and have not been classified into a category as yet.

P r i v a c y P o l i c y

Who we are

Our website address is https://botrinis.com.

Cookies

What are cookies?

Cookies are small text files that store small pieces of information. They are stored on your device when the website is loaded on your browser. These cookies help us make the website function properly, make it more secure, provide a better user experience, understand how the website performs, and analyze what works and where it needs improvement.

How do we use cookies?

Our website uses first-party and third-party cookies for several purposes. First-party cookies are mostly necessary for the website to function the right way, and they do not collect any of your personally identifiable data.

The third-party cookies used on our website are mainly for understanding how the website performs, how you interact with our website, and keeping our services secure. All in all, it provides you with a better and improved user experience and help speed up your future interactions with our website.

Manage cookie preferences

Cookie Settings

You can change your cookie preferences at any time by clicking the above button. This will let you revisit the cookie consent banner and change your preferences or withdraw your consent right away.

In addition to this, different browsers provide different methods to block and delete cookies used by websites. You can change the settings of your browser to block/delete the cookies. Listed below are the links to the support documents on how to manage and delete cookies from the major web browsers.

Chrome: https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/32050

Safari: https://support.apple.com/en-in/guide/safari/sfri11471/mac

Firefox: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/clear-cookies-and-site-data-firefox?redirectslug=delete-cookies-remove-info-websites-stored&redirectlocale=en-US

Internet Explorer: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/how-to-delete-cookie-files-in-internet-explorer-bca9446f-d873-78de-77ba-d42645fa52fc

If you are using any other web browser, please visit your browser’s official support documents.
